titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Franci Jarrard collection, 1977-1980, 2004-2017 MS 708
titlestmt.author: Norie Guthrie

publicationstmt.publisher: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

note.p: Request access to this digital material (stored on Fondren Library's nearline / non-public server) by contacting Woodson Research Center staff at woodson@rice.edu. Please use the Identifier number in your request.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-06-17 09:14:18 -0500.

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.corpname: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

did.abstract: This collection consists of digital audio files and images.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Born and raised in Houston, Franci Files began hanging out at Sand Mountain Coffee House in the late 1960s. She befriended members of the community including Guy and Susanna Clark, Townes Van Zandt, Don Sanders, and Vince Bell.

A few years later after graduating from college, she became one of the co-owners of Anderson Fair Retail Restaurant. As one of the crew, she organized and handled food preparation, specifically the spaghetti lunches.

As the 1980s approached, Franci Files married Stephen Jarrard and began to explore her own musical career. She teamed up with her husband as a duo, performed in the band Terry and the Telephones, and lent vocals to Richard Dobson's second album, "The Big Taste."

Ready for a change, in the early 1980s, Franci and Stephen Jarrard relocated to the Austin-area. They continued to explore their music. Franci Jarrard started to play the accordion and performed with Richard Dobson when he played in Texas. In the 1990s, Stephen and Franci participated in the strolling trios Europa Trio with Javier Chaparro and Troika with Ann Mesrobian.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of digital audio files and images documenting the Houston folk scene of the 1970s-1980.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Request access to this digital material (stored on Fondren Library's nearline / non-public server) by contacting Woodson Research Center staff at woodson@rice.edu. Please use the Identifier number in your request. This material is open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from this material must be obtained from the creators.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Franci Jarrard in September 2017.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Franci Jarrard collection, 1977-1980, 2004-2017, MS 708, Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These digitized audio files consist of one master copy wav and one access copy mp3. Audio files contain Vince Bell playing live at Anderson Fair Retail Restaurant. Tracks include: "Roll Me Easy," "Nothin'," "What a Change She's Made in Me," "Oklahoma Wind," "From Your Eyes," "Slowly Goes the Motion," "Ladance at the Last Chance Saloon," "All through My Days," "Me and Loretta," "Even Cowboys Get the Blues," "I Shall Be Released," "Willin'," "Long Distance Lover," "Guacamole Queen," "I've Come to See Your Truck"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These digitized audio files consist of one master copy wav and one access copy mp3. Audio files contain Bill Cade "a live in the living room" recording. Tracks include: "Cottonfields," "Roll Me Easy," "Saturday," "Storm on the River," "Tennessee Stud," "Song Bird," "It's a Sin," "Balloon Man," "Sweet Misery"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These digitized audio files consist of one master copy wav and one access copy mp3. Audio files contain Bill Cade and Stephen Jarrard live at Anderson Fair Retail Restaurant. Tracks include: "Sailin' Shoes," "Close Encounters," "Hotel Mirabella, "A Political Blues," "Ships at Sea," "Black Mountain Rag," "Poor Pitiful Me," "Saturday," "Let's Get Lost in the Lights Tonite," "Lay Down Sally," "Rodeo Man," "Paradise," "Berkley Woman"

did.unittitle: Stephen Jarrard and Franci Files, Bill Cade

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These digitized audio files consist of one master copy wav and one access copy mp3. Audio files contain songs by Stephen Jarrard and Franci Files on "The Little Ol' Show That Comes on After Monty Python" and Bill Cade with Stephen Jarrard. Tracks include: "Morning Breeze," "Last Dance at the Last Chance Saloon," "Pineapple and Rum," "Merry Go Round," "Angels in Disguise," "Railroad Blues," "Saturday," "Tenessee Stud" "A Woman's Place," "Berkley Woman," "Paradise," "Good Night Irene," "So Long Honey Bare," "In Love with a Good Woman," "Doing the Best You Can," "Don't Let the Sunshine Fool You," "Gotta Get Back to Texas," "Hey Saturday," "Big River" - Not all tracks listed.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These digitized audio files consist of one master copy wav and one access copy mp3. Audio files contain songs by Stephen Jarrard and Franci Files, Eric Taylor, and Bill Cade.

scopecontent.p: These digitized audio files consist of one master copy wav and one access copy mp3. Audio files contain songs by Stephen Jarrard, Eric Taylor, Bill Cade, John Grimaudo, and Linda Lowe [?] recorded live at Anderson Fair Retail Restaurant. Tracks include: 1st track is missing, "Rooty Toot Toot," "Joselin Jocelyn," "Angels in Disguise," "Shoe Shine Boy," "France Blues," "Losing / Willing," "Mooney," "By and By," "Good Mornin' Blues," "Sun Down Blues," "Boats," "Game of Hearts," "Cocaine," "Viper," "Goin' Down to Baltimore," "Sweet Misery," "Lay Down Sally," "Take Five," Track 20 guitar tuning, "Company"

scopecontent.p: These digitized audio files consist of one master copy wav and one access copy mp3. Audio files contain The Horse's Mouth and Dr. Rockit playing live at Anderson Fair Retail Restaurant. Tracks include: "Hear Those Jungle Drums," "The Blues Won't Take You by Surprise," "Tossing and Turning," "Midnight Hour," "I Love the Woman," "Signifying Monkey," "Hey Pocky-Way," "Walking the Dog," "Route 66," "Mornin' Rain," "Road Runner," "Money," "Anyday Now"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These digitized audio files consist of one master copy wav and one access copy mp3. Audio files contain Terry and the Telephones playing live at Anderson Fair Retail Restaurant. Tracks include: "Bright City Lights," "New World," "Something Good," "Tan Shoes and Pink Shoelaces," "Just Gimme Some Kind of Sign," "Little Sister," "So Fine," "Tonite's the Nite," "Hooked on Love," "What Can I Do," "Together Again," "Hats," "Walk with the Wild West End," "Tan Shoes and Pink Shoelaces," "Bright City Lites," "Good Clean Fun," "A Woman's World," "Let the Good Times Roll," "Tune into Heaven," "Give Me Your Love in a Song"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These digitized audio files consist of one master copy wav and one access copy mp3. Audio files contain the Cypress Swamp Stompers live at Anderson Fair Retail Restaurant. Tracks include: "Sniff," "Red Man," "Georgia Brown," "Beggar Man," "Footprints in the Snow," "Dog's Rag," "My Windown Faces South," "This Heart Is Mine," "Miss Mollie," "Jersualem Ridge," "White Oak Stomp," "Palmadell [ sp?] Portal Service"

scopecontent.p: These digitized audio files consist of one master copy wav and one access copy mp3. Audio files contain John Grimaudo and Dr. Rockit live at Anderson Fair Retail Restaurant.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These digitized audio files consist of one master copy wav and one access copy mp3. Audio files contain Dr. Rockit live at Anderson Fair Retail Restaurant. There are 3 CD tracks, but ? songs. Songs include: "?"; "Hey Pocky A-Way"; "Come on Dance"; "Lean Mean, But Good"; "High Blood Pressure"; "Signifying Monkey"; "The Blues Stew"; "The Tighten Up"; "96 Tears"; "Louie Louie"; "Jailhouse Rock"; "School Day"; "Dr. Feelgood"; "Road Runner"; "Money"; "I Love the Woman"; "Gimme Some Lovin'"; "Twist and Shout"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These digitized audio files consist of one master copy wav and one access copy mp3. Audio files contain songs by Rick, André, Pete, and Jerry in Houston. Tracks include: "Mr. Blue," "How Come You Don't Want What You Got", "Ballad of Hank and Rita," "Full Time Woman," "Spittin' in the Wind"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These digitized audio files consist of one master copy wav and one access copy mp3. Audio files contain Bill Cade and friends playing live at Anderson Fair Retail Restaurant.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These digitized audio files consist of one master copy wav and one access copy mp3. Audio files contain the Rat Creek songs: "Where the Old Gret Divide Starts the Young Rio Grande," "Backyard," "Cat in the Window," "Don't Cork That Bottle," "Evant Stockyards," "Everyone's Full," "Jug Band Music," "Ripple in Still Water," "Intro," "Steel Guitar Rag," "Back Street Girl," "White Freight Liner," "Stranded," "Goin' Back to Texas," "Truck Drivin' Man," "Banjoy Song," "In the Jailhouse Now," "Old Kentucky Home," "Anyone Who Must Leave Us," "Weekend," "Fade." Songs recorded at the Old Quarter, Saxon Pub, Rat Manor, and by Pete Gorisch, primarily from 1971-1973.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These digitized audio files consist of one master copy wav and one access copy mp3. Audio files contain a live performance by Aileen and Elkin at Anderson Fair Retail Restaurant. Tracks include: "Jolie Girl," "Country Girl," "Back to the Hills," "Paradise," "Living Country Style," "Starving Miners," "Love Is a Rose," "Squealie's Love," "Sidewalk Man," "For You," "Regina," "Cowboys"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These digitized audio files consist of one master copy wav and one access copy mp3. Audio files contain Vince Bell playing live at Anderson Fair Retail Restaurant. Tracks include: 1- "Oklahoma Wind," 2 - "Words and Games," 3 - "Roll Me Easy / Mississippi Memory," 4 - "Slowly," 5 - "Train Whore," 6 - "Any Day Now," 7 - "The Blue Moon Lounge," 8 - "I Shall Be Released," 9 - "?" 10 - Audience cheering 11 - "Rainbow," 12 - "Coreena"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These digitized audio files consist of one master copy wav and one access copy mp3. Audio files contain Bill Cade. Tracks include: "26 Miles," "Fannin Street," "If It Wasn't for the Wind," "Trouble in Mind," "Pollin'," "Saturday," "It's a Sin," "American Dream," "Ace," "Heart of N'Orleans," "Down the Road," "I'll Be Your Baby Tonite," "Camp Hambone," "Auld Lang Syne"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These digitized audio files consist of one master copy wav and one access copy mp3. Audio files contain Bill Cade in the living room. Tracks include: "Too Long in the City," "Homemade Kites," "Trouble in Mind," "Good Mornin' Blues," "Heart of New Orleans," "Twenty Six Miles," "If Only I Hadn't Loved You So Well," "Balloon Man"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The audio tracks for this CD are corrupted. We only have a record of the tracks, which include: "Tree Balling Blues," "Police Dog Blues," "Take Five," "Chesterfield Blues," "Last Fair Deal," "Wing and a Prayer," "Rampart Street," "Terrible [?] Blues"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These digitized audio files consist of one master copy wav and one access copy mp3. Audio files contain Stephen Jarrard and Franci Files live at Hard Thymes Soup Kitchen. Tracks include: "Cakewalk," "Louisiana Man," "I Ain't Gonna Think about Trouble Anymore," "Hey Mr. Spaceman," "Circus Life," "May You Never," "Sailing Shoes," "Sweet Sweet Shine," "Jesus on the Main Line," Track 10 dead air, "Too Long in the City," "Last Dance at the Last Chance Saloon," "Silver Track," "The Boats They Come They Go," "If the Blues," "The Blues Won't Take You By Surprise," "Living on Tulsa Time," "I'm Goin' Fishing," "Do Re Me," "End"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These digitized audio files consist of one master copy wav and one access copy mp3. Audio files contain Bill Staines live at Friendly Folk. Tracks include: "Old Jack," "A Tree in Nebraska," "Cayote My Old Friend," "Yodel Song," "Oklahoma Bound," "Roseville Fair," "Jolie Girl, "The Boats," "Miles Upon Your Shoes," "North Land," "For a Dancer," "Crazy Leslie," "Hauling in the Wood," "Hard Times," "The Red Clay Country Blues," "Repaint You Thinners," "Where I Live"

did.unittitle: Townes Van Zandt with Mickey White

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These digitized audio files consist of one master copy wav and one access copy mp3. Audio files contain Townes Van Zandt with Mickey White playing live at Anderson Fair Retail Restaurant. Tracks include: "All I Got Is Yesterday," "Dollar Bill Blues," "Don't Take It So Bad," "Snowing on Ratton," "Pancho and Lefty," "Sometimes It Happens That Way," "When I'm Gone," "Loretta," "White Freight Liner," "The Cuckoo," "The Indian Cowboy," "The Girls"
